titleStmt.title: The triumph-royal containing a short account of the most remarkable battels, sieges, sea-fights, treaties, and famous atchievements [sic] of the princes of the House of Nassau &c. describ'd in the triumphal arches, piramids, pictures, inscriptions, and devices erected at the Hague in Honour of William III, King of England, Scotland, France and Ireland ...
titleStmt.author: Beek, J., fl. 1691-1702.

titleStmt.title: The triumph-royal containing a short account of the most remarkable battels, sieges, sea-fights, treaties, and famous atchievements [sic] of the princes of the House of Nassau &c. describ'd in the triumphal arches, piramids, pictures, inscriptions, and devices erected at the Hague in Honour of William III, King of England, Scotland, France and Ireland ...
titleStmt.author: Beek, J., fl. 1691-1702.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Hen. Rhodes ... and John Harris ...

notesStmt.note: Caption title: The glorious reception of William III, King of England at his entrance into the Hague, the 5th of February, in the year 1691.
"First done in Dutch, then into French, and now into English."
Imperfect: tightly bound with loss of print.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
